Description: A Product Owner (PO) is responsible for defining, prioritizing, and communicating the product vision and strategy to the development team. The PO acts as the voice of the customer, gathering and analyzing customer feedback and market trends to determine what features and functionality the product should have.

Required.SkillDescription: Experience in product management, and the ability to define and manage the product vision, roadmap, and backlog
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and experience in implementing and managing these practices at the team level
Ability to identify and analyze user and customer needs, and to translate these needs into product features and requirements
Ability to manage the product backlog, prioritize product features, and collaborate with Agile teams to deliver value to customers
Ability to identify and manage stakeholders, and to ensure that their needs are reflected in the product backlog and prioritization

Recommended.SkillDescription: Certification in Agile methodologies, such as Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) or PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)
Understanding of business concepts and the ability to align product development with business objectives and priorities
Understanding of technical concepts and the ability to communicate effectively with technical team members and stakeholders
Ability to analyze market trends and competition, and to use this information to inform product strategy and development
Understanding of risk management principles and techniques, and the ability to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with product development
Ability to analyze data and metrics related to product performance and customer feedback, and to use this information to improve product development and strategy
Understanding of User Experience (UX) design principles and the ability to work effectively with UX designers to improve the user experience of products and applications
Understanding of data science concepts and the ability to work effectively with data scientists to improve the data-driven decision-making of product development teams and stakeholders
Understanding of product marketing principles and techniques, and the ability to effectively market and position products to target customers and markets
Ability to develop and communicate a clear and compelling value proposition for the product, and to use this to guide product development and marketing efforts
Experience in product development, and the ability to work effectively with Agile development teams to deliver high-quality products
Experience in owning and managing products through their entire lifecycle, from ideation to release and maintenance
Experience in managing a product line, and the ability to develop and implement product line strategies that maximize revenue and profitability
Understanding of Lean Startup principles and techniques, and the ability to use these to validate product ideas and to iteratively develop and refine products
Ability to conduct competitive analysis and to use this information to inform product strategy and development
Ability to develop and communicate a product roadmap, and to use this to guide product development and to align product development with strategic objectives
Ability to develop and communicate a clear and compelling product vision, and to use this to guide product development and to align product development with strategic objectives
